brief_description: The role of TLR4 signaling in TH2 response to papain was measured by IL-4 and antibody production. The involvement of MyD88, TRIF, and oxidized phospholipids in the TLR4 pathway was examined. Basophil recruitment to the draining lymph node through dendritic-cell-secreted CCL7 was investigated as a component of the TLR4/TRIF pathway.
brief_title: The role of TLR4 and TRIF signaling in TH2 response to papain
condition_studied: TH2 cell response to challenge with OVA and papain
description: The role of TLR4 signalling in TH2 response to papain was measured by IL-4 and antibody production. The involvement of MyD88, TRIF, and oxidized phospholipids in the TLR4 pathway was examined. Basophil recruitment to the draining lymph node through dendritic-cell-secreted CCL7 was investigated as a component of the TLR4/TRIF pathway.
hypothesis: Dendritic cell response to papain requires both chemokine CCL7 signaling to basophils and reactive oxygen species activation of the TLR4/TRIF pathway.
objectives: To investigate the mechanisms of dendritic-cell-dependent ROS-mediated papain response.
official_title: The role of TLR4 and TRIF signaling in TH2 response to papain
